sentences: Allan Pineda Lindo (born November 28, 1974), better known by his stage name apl.de.ap (IPA: ), is a Filipino-American rapper, singer and record producer best known as a member of the hip hop group Black Eyed Peas.
Pineda revealed to People Magazine in 2011 that he is legally blind in both of his eyes, suffering from nystagmus and has had this condition his entire career.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His vision was corrected in 2012.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His youngest brother, Joven Pineda Deala, was murdered at the age of 22 in February 2009 in Porac, Pampanga.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: === 1988–2000: Formations and The Black Eyed Peas ===
section: == Musical career == | === 1988–2000: Formations and The Black Eyed Peas ===

sentences: The Black Eyed Peas date back to 1988, when eighth-graders will.i.am and apl.de.ap met and began rapping and performing together around Los Angeles.
section: == Musical career == | === 1988–2000: Formations and The Black Eyed Peas ===

sentences: The pair signed to Ruthless Records (run by Eazy-E) in 1992, catching the attention of Eazy-E manager Jerry Heller's nephew.
section: == Musical career == | === 1988–2000: Formations and The Black Eyed Peas ===

sentences: After Eazy-E died in 1995, Atban Klann reformed and changed their name to Black Eyed Pods, and then Black Eyed Peas.
section: == Musical career == | === 1988–2000: Formations and The Black Eyed Peas ===

sentences: After being signed to Interscope Records and releasing their debut, Behind the Front (1998) the group (and their accompanying live band) earned critical acclaim.
section: == Musical career == | === 1988–2000: Formations and The Black Eyed Peas ===

sentences: Their second album was Bridging the Gap (2000), which included the single "Request + Line" featuring Macy Gray.
section: == Musical career == | === 1988–2000: Formations and The Black Eyed Peas ===
== Musical career == | === 2000–2003: Elephunk ===

sentences: In November 2001, work began on a third Black Eyed Peas album, Elephunk.
section: == Musical career == | === 2000–2003: Elephunk ===

sentences: Development of the album began on November 2, 2001, and was released just under two years later in 2003.
section: == Musical career == | === 2000–2003: Elephunk ===

section: == Musical career == | === 2000–2003: Elephunk ===

sentences: After the success of Elephunk, the Peas were approached by EA games to feature some of their music on the 2004 game The Urbz.

sentences: The group released their breakthrough single, "Where Is the Love?", in November 2002 (featuring Justin Timberlake, although he did not appear in the video).

== Musical career == | === 2003–2006: Monkey Business ===

sentences: In November 2003, work began on a fourth Black Eyed Peas album, entitled Monkey Business, the second album with new band member Fergie.
section: == Musical career == | === 2003–2006: Monkey Business ===

sentences: Upon the success of Monkey Business, which was released in 2005, the album was certified three times Platinum by the RIAA in the U.S. and has sold over 10 million copies worldwide.
section: == Musical career == | === 2003–2006: Monkey Business ===

sentences: === 2009–2011: Continuation with The Black Eyed Peas with second hiatus =

sentences: In early 2009, both Fergie and the group left A&M Records for unknown reasons, both Fergie and the group are still with Interscope Records.
section: == Musical career == | === 2009–2011: Continuation with The Black Eyed Peas with second hiatus ===

sentences: The group's fifth studio album, The E.N.D. ("The Energy Never Dies"), was released on June 9, 2009.
section: == Musical career == | === 2009–2011: Continuation with The Black Eyed Peas with second hiatus ===

sentences: In the United States, the album became the ninth album to top the one million mark in sales in 2009.
section: == Musical career == | === 2009–2011: Continuation with The Black Eyed Peas with second hiatus ===

sentences: The E.N.D. was the 7th best-selling album of 2009 in the U.S. It also debuted at number one in Australia, number two in New Zealand and three in the United Kingdom.
section: == Musical career == | === 2009–2011: Continuation with The Black Eyed Peas with second hiatus ===

sentences: In 2009, the group became one of only artists to have simultaneously held the No. 1 and No. 2 spots on the Billboard Hot 100, with their singles "Boom Boom Pow" and "I Gotta Feeling", with the next single "Meet Me Halfway" achieving similar success, from the album The E.N.D..

section: == Musical career == | === 2011–present: We Can Be Anything, Solo ventures ===

sentences: On May 19, 2012, apl.de.ap attended the We Can Be Anything Campaign Charity Gala Dinner at The Westbury Hotel in London.
section: == Musical career == | === 2011–present: We Can Be Anything, Solo ventures ===

sentences: In March 2013, apl.de.ap was confirmed to be one of the four coaches of the inaugural season of The Voice of the Philippines.
section: == Musical career == | === 2011–present: We Can Be Anything, Solo ventures ===

sentences: On January 31, 2015, apl.de.ap revealed his newest single and its accompanying music video, "Be", featuring Honey Cocaine and Jessica Reynoso.

sentences: On June 12, 2014, he confirmed his return for the second season of The Voice of the Philippines.
section: == Musical career == | === 2011–present: We Can Be Anything, Solo ventures ===

sentences: On November 18, 2008, he founded the Apl Foundation to help various communities and children in the Philippines and throughout Asia.
section: == Other ventures == | === Philanthropy ===

sentences: In 2011, after expressing his desire to help improve the education situation in the Philippines, his foundation formed a partnership with the Ninoy and Cory Aquino Foundation (NCAF) to create the "We Can Be Anything" advocacy campaign where Apl.de.ap and NCAF plan to build 10,000 classrooms in two years or less through the advocacy.
section: == Other ventures == | === Philanthropy ===

sentences: During an interview made by The Huffington Post on 2012, he stated that he has plans on launching his own talent show in the Philippines.
section: == Other ventures == | === The Voice of The Philippines ===

sentences: On March 1, 2013, ABS-CBN has confirmed that they are in the final stages of negotiating with his management to become its fourth and last official coach of the show.
section: == Other ventures == | === The Voice of The Philippines ===

sentences: In 2014, he opened his independent record label, BMBX Entertainment, whose name refers to 'boombox'.
